summary.intent: Make the standards and skills artifact counts in the remediation plan UI more visually prominent, replacing small muted text with larger, badge-styled blue highlighted numbers.
summary.outcome: Both RemediateTab.tsx and RemediationHistoryCard.tsx were updated with larger text sizes and blue highlight styling. All 1319 tests passed, lint was clean, and changes were committed as an isolated commit.

repo: Project uses `bun run test` and `bun run lint` for verification, with `rtk` as a wrapper for running commands including git operations.
Tailwind utility `text-body` maps to 0.875rem; `text-base` is 1rem — the project has a custom `text-body` class distinct from Tailwind defaults.
The repo had other pre-existing unstaged modifications unrelated to this task at commit time, so targeted `git add` of specific files was necessary.

code.finding: Artifact count line uses `text-body text-slate-300` with a `font-semibold text-slate-100` span; changed outer to `text-base` and count span to `font-bold text-blue-400 bg-blue-500/15 px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded` for badge effect.
Count sentence used `text-xs text-slate-400`; bumped to `text-sm` and wrapped `formatArtifactCount()` output in `<span className="font-bold text-blue-400">`.

workflow: Running lint through `rtk lint bun run lint` produced misleading output; running `bun run lint` directly was needed to confirm clean pass.
The `rtk` wrapper intercepts command output (e.g., `2>&1 | tail -5`) in ways that can obscure real results — verify directly when output looks ambiguous.

friction: The `rtk` command wrapper produced misleading lint output that appeared to show an error; required a second direct `bun run lint` invocation to confirm the build was actually clean.
open_items: Several other modified files were present in the working tree at commit time but left unstaged — their purpose and ownership are unknown and may need follow-up.
